The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: This course broadened my knowledge of literature that is related to my research.  It forced me to examine literature from a more multi-faceted perspective.

Read a lot of great primary texts, with emphasis in placing them in their historical context. Also was helpful to have a class with people from a wide variety of disciplines, which contributed to discussion.
I gained a general knowledge of Renaissance texts and culture.
I wish this particular course was a year long.  I would have liked to spend more time in the texts.

Strengths: great reading list, great instructors, good participants

Weaknesses: Discussion was somewhat scattered at points

Improved: Focus on specific passages, questions, etc to try to drill down on one aspect of the books

The course was useful as it exposed me to a broad number of topics. This is important, and since the final paper was not a term paper it was adapted to a general study, so I found the homework assignments to be appropriate for an interdisciplinary class.
Absolutely!  If nothing else, this course broadens the intellectual discourse.

Yes, I would recommend someone take this course. It gives the students great exposure to some wonderful primary texts from the Renaissance, as well as access to professors who can put them in their contexts.
Yes, if they want a general awareness of Renaissance culture and literature.
